etymologies: early 18th century: from French or Italian, from Italian tromba ‘trumpet’

definitions: a large brass wind instrument with straight tubing in three sections, ending in a bell over the player's left shoulder, different fundamental notes being made using a forward-pointing extendable slide.
shortDefinitions: large brass wind instrument with straight tubing in three sections

definitions: an organ stop with the quality of a trombone.
shortDefinitions: organ stop with quality of trombone
